forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Light Rain then Mostly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 10pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West southwest wind 2 to 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 2 to 6 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, the air clings to the promise of a gentle rain earlier in the evening. The clouds loom softly, veiling the fading sunlight and enveloping the city in a muted glow. Temperatures hover comfortably around fifty, and a faint whisper of wind plays through the streets—barely noticeable at only a couple of miles per hour. A 20% chance of rain serves as a reminder of the unpredictable nature of our beloved Bay Area climate, while the atmosphere carries the coolness that often accompanies this time of year.

Looking ahead to Sunday, expect the clouds to remain a constant companion, casting their shadow over the city and bringing a high near sixty-three. The weather's pleasant chill invites layered clothing; a light jacket over a cozy sweater would harmonize well with the day’s hues. While San Francisco may not parade in vibrant sunshine today, it offers an intimate experience—ideal for a leisurely stroll through one of the tranquil parks, perusing a local bookstore, or indulging in a quiet café moment with a warm drink in hand. This weather holds a charm; not complaining, merely inviting a sense of calm and reflection as the lights begin to twinkle against the encroaching night.
